meanings.definition: A system of rules that a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members and may enforce by the imposition of penalties.
meanings.sent1: The laws of the land dictate how people should behave.
meanings.sent2: Breaking the laws can lead to serious consequences.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken cross the road? To avoid breaking any laws!
meanings.sent4: In nature, the laws of gravity always pull objects towards the Earth.
meanings.sent5: Learning about laws helps us understand how society functions.

meanings.definition: A statement of fact, deduced from observation, to the effect that a particular natural or scientific phenomenon always occurs if certain conditions are present.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the laws of physics to understand how the world works.
meanings.sent2: The laws of thermodynamics explain energy transfer in systems.
meanings.sent3: Why did the plant refuse to grow? It was tired of following the laws of photosynthesis!
meanings.sent4: Just like the laws of nature, some things in life are inevitable.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the laws of chemistry helps us create new materials.
